title.narrative: Implementation of the Global Ocean Observing System (GOOS) and the ARGO Array of profiling Floats in the Southwest Pacific Ocean

description.narrative: Environment - General is used when Environment sectors are unknown or foreign assistance is allocated to multiple sectors within this category.

The Secretariat of the Pacific Regional Environment Programme (SPREP), through the Pacific Islands Global Ocean Observing System (PI-GOOS) supports the implementation of Argo in the South Pacific Region through maintenance of current agreement with Pacific Island State to operate profiling floats within Exclusive Economic Zones (presently 12) and works to expand the participation of SPREP Member States in Argo. The SEREAD (Scientific Educational Resources and Experience Associated with the Deployment of Argo profiling floats in the South Pacific Ocean) Program instructs teachers and teacher trainers on oceanographic sciences for implementation in education curricula to improve the understanding of ocean and atmospheric sciences in order to improve the uptake and use of data, information and products being generated by the Program.

description.narrative: Samoa has no standing military and relies on assistance from its partners to provide for defense needs. Samoa's Maritime Police Unit serves a key border control and maritime policing function and provides coast guard and emergency response capabilities. Targeted U.S. assistance to the Maritime Police Unit aids Samoa by providing increased capacity for maritime policing, coastal defense, and emergency response.
